title: Connelly's alt-college football awards: Catch of the Year, 'Dog in Him' and more
content: College football's official awards will go out this weekend. We're honoring more players tonight; watch the College Football Awards at 7 ET on ESPN.

title: Moore facing charges of stalking, home invasion
content: Sherrone Moore, abruptly fired this week as Michigan football coach, was charged Friday with three crimes including home invasion and stalking a person he had dated, prosecutors said.

title: Utes' Whittingham stepping down after 21 years
content: Utah coach Kyle Whittingham announced he is stepping down after the team's Dec. 31 bowl game. Whittingham is the Utes' all-time leader in coaching wins with 177.

title: FIFA hails 5M WC ticket requests amid backlash
content: FIFA said Friday that it had received five million ticket requests in the first 24 hours of the third phase of ticket sales for the 2026 World Cup, despite widespread backlash from supporter groups to the prices being charged.

title: Steelers' Watt has surgery for collapsed lung
content: Steelers pass rusher T.J. Watt had surgery to repair a partially collapsed lung, his brother J.J. Watt posted on social media.

title: Sabally battling concussion, out for Unrivaled tip
content: Mercury forward Satou Sabally is out indefinitely for Unrivaled as she continues to deal with symptoms from a concussion suffered in Game 3 of the WNBA Finals in October.

title: Harbaugh 'still processing' Moore's firing, arrest
content: Chargers coach Jim Harbaugh says he is "still processing" the abrupt firing of former Michigan coach Sherrone Moore after the two worked closely together with the Wolverines.

title: Colts laud Rivers' readiness, not revealing starter
content: Coach Shane Steichen would not confirm whether he planned to start Philip Rivers in what would be his first NFL game in five years.

title: Clark pushes for CBA compromise: 'Need to play'
content: Caitlin Clark discussed the need for compromise in the ongoing WNBA CBA negotiations at USA Basketball camp on Friday, her first organized practice since a soft tissue injury sidelined her for most of the 2025 season.

title: üèÅ Michael Jordan pushes NASCAR into future
content: The way NASCAR had long done business had become obsolete, but the antitrust suit brought by Michael Jordan and settled on Thursday, changes that.

title: NBA 25 under 25: The best young stars, ranked by future potential
content: Which youngsters are among the next class of superstars? Which are already there? Our NBA experts rank their top 25 under 25.

title: Has trading for an NBA superstar become too risky? Insiders examine the new normal
content: One superstar trade away from NBA title contention? You better be right. If not, the consequences are harsh.

title: Our guide to every Week 15 NFL game: Matchup previews, predictions and what's at stake
content: Who can improve their chances of making the playoffs? And who is likely out? Picks, predictions and stats for every Week 15 game.

title: Who are the NFL‚Äôs hottest head coaching candidates? We list nine coordinators plus one wild card
content: Will former head coaches Vance Joseph and Matt Nagy get another shot? Could Joe Brady get interviews? We stacked the hottest coaching candidates right now.

title: Top 50 USMNT players, ranked by club form: A new No. 1 leads the American pool
content: Who are the 50 best USMNT players as 2025 comes to a close? We have a first-time No. 1 in our ranking as the USMNT Player Performance Index returns.

title: Who is willing to spend to keep up with the Dodgers and Blue Jays this winter?
content: Baseball insiders were abuzz over L.A. and Toronto at this week's winter meetings, as both have the money -- and pull -- to dominate the winter.

title: Big East Bracketology preview: NCAA tournament predictions for every team
content: UConn has separated itself from St. John's. Three more teams look bubble bound. And one potential sleeper.

title: The many shirts of John Cena's WWE career
content: Before John Cena's final match, take a look back at his legendary career through the lens of his iconic shirts.

title: Preview: Everything to know about each semifinal in Las Vegas
content: The Emirates NBA Cup semifinals are officially set. Here is everything to know ahead of Saturday's games.

title: Laurens' weekend preview: Liverpool's Salah drama, Tyne-Wear derby returns, more
content: What is Julien Laurens watching this weekend? In addition to big derby games in France, the Netherlands and England, we're all wondering if Mo Salah will feature for Liverpool.

title: What could stop Haaland breaking Shearer's Premier League goal record?
content: For years, Alan Shearer's all-time record of 260 Premier League goals looked like it would never be broken.

title: Dates for Georgia-Bama, LSU-Ole Miss and every other SEC game in 2026
content: Find out when every SEC game will be, including Lane Kiffin's return to Oxford and Georgia's trip to Alabama.

title: Expert picks, best bets: Royval's path to victory at UFC Fight Night
content: Where's the value on the final UFC fight card of the year? MMA insiders and a betting expert make their picks for Brandon Royval vs. Manel Kape.

title: Don't be surprised if ... Brock Purdy, Chase Brown are league winners down the stretch
content: With the upcoming schedule, don't be surprised if Brock Purdy and Chase Brown are difference-makers down the stretch.

title: Spurs' Stephon Castle buys stake in Connecticut soccer teams
content: The former UConn guard joins the ownership group for men's and women's professional franchises where he starred in college.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Bayern plan on meeting to sign Gu√©hi
content: Bayern Munich are looking to take the initiative to try and sign Crystal Palace's Marc Gu√©hi. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: P Chidambaram Slams Karnataka Home Minister's Bulldozer Remark
content: A remark by Karnataka Home Minister G. Parameshwara on the possibility of razing down the houses of drug peddlers has drawn sharp criticism from senior Congress leader and former Union Minister P. Chidambaram.

title: Americans Skeptical Of Trump On Epstein, But Republican Doubts Ease: Survey
content: Americans are deeply skeptical of President Donald Trump's handling of the Jeffrey Epstein scandal, though he is shoring up support among his core Republican followers who have long focused on the case, a new Reuters/Ipsos poll found.

title: King Charles Says His Treatment For Cancer Can Be Reduced In New Year
content: King Charles said on Friday his treatment for cancer can be reduced in the next year as he talked about his experience living with the disease in a televised address.

title: "Peace, Understanding, Reconciliation": President Murmu's Message To Manipur
content: President Droupadi Murmu today reminded the people of Manipur that the strength of the "beautiful land" they call home lies in its diversity.

title: US Flew Bombers, Fighter Jets, Drones Along Venezuela Coast Amid Tensions
content: Fighter jets, bombers and surveillance drones: the United States military has flown a variety of aircraft along Venezuela's coast in recent weeks, an AFP analysis shows, amid growing fears of conflict between the countries.

title: On Manipur's 'Nupi Lan Day' To Honour Anti-Colonial Revolt, A Women Power Run In Delhi
content: Women from Manipur including senior citizens participated in a run in honour of the 86th Nupi Lan (Women's War) Day, in memory of revolts by the women of Manipur against British rule in 1904 and 1939.

title: Ukraine To Join EU By 2027 Under Draft Peace Proposal: Report
content: Ukraine would be slated to join the European Union by January 1 2027 under a peace proposal being discussed as part of US-mediated negotiations.

title: Indian-Origin Millionaire Crashes Tesla, Tries To Burn Down US Winery
content: An Indian-origin millionaire, Vikram Beri, was arrested in the United States for allegedly trying to set fire to a winery in California. While trying to flee, he intentionally crashed into two parked cars.

title: YouTube Removes Pakistan Reality Show Based On 'Love Island'
content: YouTube has hit pause on a dating show that whisked eight men and women from deeply conservative Pakistan to a sun-soaked Istanbul villa, where the strangers mingled, flirted and searched for chemistry.

title: Germany Accuses Russia Of Cyberattack On Air Safety, Election Interference
content: Germany on Friday accused Russia of a cyberattack targeting its air traffic control and spreading disinformation ahead of February's general election, charges dismissed by Russia as "absurd" and "baseless".

title: Freezing Rain And Floods Ravages Gaza's Tent Camps As Aid System Fails
content: Rains drenched Gaza's tent camps, and dropping temperatures chilled Palestinians huddling inside them Thursday as winter storm Byron descended on the war-battered territory.

title: EU To Indefinitely Freeze Russian Assets, Removing Obstacle To Ukraine Loan
content: The European Union looked set on Friday to indefinitely freeze Russian central bank assets held in Europe, removing a big obstacle to using the cash to help Ukraine defend itself against Moscow's invasion.

title: Ukraine Claims To Hit 2 Russian Ships With Military Equipment In Caspian Sea
content: Ukraine's special forces said on Friday they had conducted an operation alongside what they described as a local resistance movement to hit two Russian ships transporting weapons and military equipment in the Caspian sea.

title: Video: Interpreter Weeps As Ukrainian Boy Recounts Russian Bombing Horror
content: A moving scene unfolded in the European Parliament in Brussels when an interpreter broke down mid-sentence while translating the testimony of an 11-year-old Ukrainian boy who survived a Russian missile strike on a children's hospital in Vinnytsia.

title: Ratle Power Project In J&K May Get Stalled, Builder Alleges Local Interference
content: A multi-billion dollar hydropower project in Jammu and Kashmir is facing threat of closure. The construction company alleges political interference and attempts to mobilise workers to stall work.

title: Assam Woman Arrested Over Pak Link, Unexplained Fund Transfers
content: A woman from Assam's Sonitpur district has been arrested after the police found suspicious foreign-linked financial transactions. She was purportedly married to a Pakistani national in Dubai.

title: Haryana Man Drove 800 Km To Get Son To School For Exam During IndiGo Chaos
content: Rajnath Panghal had to drive hundreds of kilometres to make sure his son reaches his school in time ahead of exams.

title: No Proof Of Burning Lamp On Top Of Hill, Tamil Nadu Tells Court
content: The Tamil Nadu advocate general has asked petitioners to prove that the 'deepathoon' on top of Thiruparukundram hill is a genuine practice. The top lawyer said that for centuries it has been a practice of lighting Karthigai Deepam.

title: Goa Club Fire Highlights: Goa Cops Will Not Go To Thailand To Bring Back Luthras
content: Goa Nightclub Fire Tragedy Highlights: Authorities in Thailand on Friday started the deportation process to send back Saurabh and Gaurav Luthra back to India.

title: 'Tamil Nadu govt anti-Sanatan': Big BJP, DMK face-off in LS; uproar over Deepam row
content: BJP leader Anurag Thakur accused the Tamil Nadu government of an "anti-Sanatan" stance over the Karthigai Deepam dispute. The state government defied Madras High Court orders to light a ceremonial lamp at Thiruparankundram temple, leading to contempt proceedings and protests. The government has appealed to the Supreme Court.

title: In terror acts, rights of accused subservient to national interest: Supreme Court
content: The Supreme Court has ruled that individual liberty, while crucial, cannot override national security concerns in UAPA cases.  Upholding this, the court denied bail to accused in the Jnaneshwari Express derailment case, emphasizing that barbaric acts endangering national integrity are not excusable, even after prolonged incarceration.  The apex court stressed the need for expeditious trials in such grave matters.

title: Cabinet clears SHANTI bill to open nuclear power to pvt sector
content: The Union Cabinet has greenlit a bill to open India's nuclear power sector to private players, a move crucial for achieving 100 GW nuclear capacity by 2047. The SHANTI Bill proposes changes to civil liability laws, caps supplier liability, and allows up to 49% foreign direct investment. This aims to boost domestic energy production and meet net-zero targets.

title: Rs 12k cr for 2-phase census, will allow self-enumeration
content: India gears up for Census 2027 with a Rs 11,718 crore budget, marking the first digital enumeration and inclusion of a caste count. The two-phase exercise, starting April 2026, will utilize mobile apps for data collection. Reference date is March 1, 2027, with special provisions for snow-bound regions. This census aims to provide accurate population data for future development planning.

title: Rupee at historic low: How 9% real depreciation could reshape India‚Äôs economy - explained
content: The Indian rupee is experiencing a significant decline against the US dollar, which could impact inflation, exports, and corporate margins. While short-term effects are challenging, a weaker rupee could boost long-term growth by encouraging domestic production and improving export competitiveness. Experts anticipate this trend may continue due to trade deal uncertainties and capital flow pressures.

title: Microsoft AI CEO opens up: 'Told to quit school at 16' - Suleyman on working-class life
content: Microsoft AI chief Mustafa Suleyman reveals his working-class London upbringing shaped his tech vision. The DeepMind co-founder, whose Syrian taxi driver father and nurse mother urged him to learn a trade, lived independently from age 16 before dropping out of Oxford to help Muslim youth post-9/11. Now he champions AI for social good and universal basic income.

title: Govt approves 125-day rural job bill to replace MGNREGA
content: The government has approved a bill to replace MGNREGA with the Pujya Bapu Gramin Rozgar Guarantee Bill, promising 125 workdays per household. This move aims to counter opposition criticism on funding and boost employment claims, particularly in rural areas. Projects will align with Viksit Bharat National Infra Stack, prioritizing water security.

title: Savarkar never got due recognition: Amit Shah
content: Home Minister Amit Shah lauded Vinayak Damodar Savarkar's fight against untouchability and social evils, stating he never received due recognition. Unveiling a statue, RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat honored the ideologue's enduring legacy. Shah highlighted Savarkar's patriotism, reformist zeal, and literary contributions, emphasizing his resilience during imprisonment and unwavering belief in India's freedom.

title: Rahul Gandhi asks for air pollution debate in Lok Sabha, govt agrees
content: Rahul Gandhi has demanded a Lok Sabha debate on the severe air pollution plaguing Indian cities, urging the government to present a concrete plan. Meanwhile, Delhi's air quality remains 'very poor' and is predicted to turn 'severe' by Sunday, with light winds failing to disperse pollutants. Moderate fog is also expected.

title: Networking battle: Cisco CFO slams HPE-Juniper deal; Says Cisco is gaining
content: Cisco's CFO Mark Patterson highlighted market uncertainty stemming from Hewlett Packard Enterprise's $14 billion Juniper acquisition. He suggested this integration, particularly in wireless, is causing customer confusion, which Cisco is capitalizing on. This echoes previous Cisco sentiments about the deal's disruptive potential for enterprise clients.

title: J&K: LG hands appointment letters to kin of Nowgam police station blast victims
content: Jammu and Kashmir Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha met families of those killed in the Nowgam police station blast, providing them with appointment letters on compassionate grounds. He lauded the J&K Police for dismantling a terror network, emphasizing national support for the affected families. The blast, described as accidental, occurred during the examination of seized explosives.

title: Ahead of PM Modi's 3-nation tour, FTA with Oman gets Cabinet nod
content: Prime Minister Modi's upcoming visit to Oman is poised to forge a robust economic and strategic alliance, potentially including a free trade agreement and a joint defense partnership. India anticipates receiving spare parts for its retired Jaguar fleet from Oman.

title: Congress MP claims BJP neta was drunk during Rahul Gandhi's speech
content: A Congress MP has accused a senior BJP member of attending Lok Sabha proceedings "drunk" during Rahul Gandhi's speech on electoral reforms.  The MP cited the individual's "repeated gestures" and "tottering" as evidence, urging the BJP to prevent such incidents. This allegation follows a recent row over a TMC MP allegedly "vaping" in the House, highlighting concerns over parliamentary decorum.

title: Google may have revealed to OpenAI how an AI browser should be ‚Äî and where Atlas misses
content: Google unveils Disco, an experimental browser that transforms browsing activity into custom web applications using its Gemini 3 AI. This  approach, powered by GenTabs, directly challenges AI browsers like OpenAI's Atlas by building apps rather than just adding chatbots.  Disco aims to redefine browser functionality with AI at its core, offering a glimpse into the future of web navigation.

title: Higher education upgrade: Bill on single regulator gets nod
content: The Union Cabinet has approved the Viksit Bharat Shiksha Adhikshan Bill, aiming to consolidate higher education regulation under a single authority, excluding medical and legal fields. This move seeks to simplify governance and enhance academic quality. Meanwhile, a parliamentary committee will question IndiGo, DGCA, and ministry officials regarding recent flight cancellations and pilot rest rule implementation.

title: Laws governing insurance, stock markets to be rewritten
content: The Union Cabinet has approved significant reforms for the stock market and insurance sectors. The plan includes allowing 100% foreign investment in insurance, aiming to boost penetration and consumer choice.

title: Epstein scandal: US House panel releases 19 photos; Trump, Clinton appear in images
content: House Oversight Committee Democrats released 19 photos from Jeffrey Epstein's estate, showing interactions with figures like Donald Trump, Bill Clinton, and Bill Gates. The images, part of a larger cache, offer glimpses into these associations. Republicans criticized the selective release, calling it a political tactic against Trump, while Democrats demand further transparency.

title: Usain Bolt & Kasi Bennett net worth 2025: Career, family, business
content: Sprint legend Usain Bolt, estimated at $90 million net worth in 2025, continues to thrive post-retirement through endorsements and business ventures. His partner, Kasi Bennett, a model and entrepreneur, supports his endeavors while maintaining a private life. Together, they focus on their three children, balancing global success with family values.

title: Paige Shiver net worth: 55% salary hike and Sherrone Moore link spark buzz
content: University of Michigan football is in turmoil as executive assistant Paige Shiver faces intense public scrutiny. Her name is linked to former coach Sherrone Moore's firing and police detainment due to alleged inappropriate relationship rumors. Shiver's recent significant salary increase and social media silence have fueled speculation amid the ongoing investigation.

title: Megan Thee Stallion‚ÄìKlay Thompson cheating rumor explodes amid breakup buzz
content: Social media erupted with breakup rumors about Megan Thee Stallion and Klay Thompson. A single X post alleged cheating and a split. The internet quickly spread the claim, despite a complete lack of proof. No credible news outlets or official statements have confirmed the story. This highlights how quickly unverified information can trend online.

title: 'Cease all shooting': Trump says Thailand‚ÄìCambodia agree truce; claims tensions neared 'major war'
content: US President Donald Trump Friday announced Thailand and Cambodia have agreed to an immediate halt in hostilities along their disputed border. Following a conversation with both nations' prime ministers, a ceasefire was declared, returning to a previous peace accord. This development follows escalating violence and displacement of hundreds of thousands.

title: New window for coal linkage auctions to give push to reforms
content: India has launched CoalSETU, a new policy for long-term coal linkage auctions aimed at industrial use and exports. This dedicated window allows any domestic industrial buyer to bid, simplifying procedures and boosting the utilization of coal reserves. Fuel supply agreements can extend up to 15 years, with flexible use within group companies, potentially reducing imports and creating export opportunities.

title: Zubeen Garg death: 4 charged with murder; singer's cousin accused of culpable homicide
content: A Special Investigation Team has charged four individuals with murder in the Zubeen Garg death case. The singer's cousin, a suspended Assam Police officer, faces charges of culpable homicide not amounting to murder. Two personal security officers are accused of criminal breach of trust. This development follows the singer's death in Singapore, where local police initially found no foul play.

title: Anurag Thakur seeks action against TMC MP for vaping in Parliament
content: Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla has received a complaint from BJP MP Anurag Thakur regarding a TMC lawmaker allegedly using an e-cigarette inside the House. Thakur highlighted this as a serious breach of parliamentary rules and the Prohibition of Electronic Cigarettes Act, 2019. The Lok Sabha secretariat is reviewing proceedings for appropriate action.

title: Mirwaiz asks Omar govt to stop arrest of people in decades old cases
content: Hurriyat chairman Mirwaiz Umar Farooq urged the Omar Abdullah government to halt arrests in old cases, citing harassment and anxiety. He highlighted the plight of thousands of Kashmiri prisoners and called for a review of old case handling and transfer of detainees back to J&K.

title: Teachers asked to report stray dogs, outrage in J&K
content: Jammu & Kashmir's education department has mandated teachers to report and manage stray dog populations, sparking outrage from political parties and teachers' unions. Critics deem the directives "shocking" and "atrocious," arguing they undermine educators' dignity and professional roles. The orders, however, are reportedly based on Supreme Court guidelines amidst a surge in dog-bite incidents.

title: Giannis Antetokounmpo trade wish list puts Bucks in strong spot amid Heat rumor
content: Giannis Antetokounmpo reportedly lists Miami Heat as a top trade destination if he leaves the Bucks, trailing only New York. League insiders suggest Miami offers a compelling, practical landing spot, potentially involving a package of young talent and draft picks.  The Heat's history of building around stars makes them a strong contender.

title: Jaish terrorist held with M-5 rifle near IB in J&K‚Äôs Akhnoor
content: Alert BSF troops apprehended a Jaish-e-Mohammad terrorist near the Indo-Pak border in Akhnoor, Jammu and Kashmir. The operative, identified as Abdul Khalik from Rajouri, was found with an M-5 rifle and magazines. He had illegally migrated to Pakistan in 2021 and was handed over to local police for further investigation.

title: SMAT: Match-fixing scandal hits domestic cricket; 4 players suspended
content: Assam Cricket Association has suspended four players with immediate effect following allegations of involvement in corrupt practices during the Syed Mushtaq Ali T20 Trophy. The players are accused of attempting to instigate current team members for fixing. The BCCI's Anti-Corruption and Security Unit conducted an inquiry, leading to criminal proceedings and an FIR against the accused.

title: Pak PM 'humiliated': After 40-min wait, Sharif 'gatecrashes' Putin-Erdogan meet - watch
content: Pakistani Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif reportedly "gatecrashed" a meeting between Russian President Vladimir Putin and Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan after waiting over 40 minutes. This incident occurred as Sharif continues efforts to strengthen ties with Moscow, despite acknowledging Russia's close partnership with India.

title: 'Sanskrit ours too': Pak varsity launches course; Mahabharat, Gita on the cards
content: In a historic move, Pakistan's Lahore University of Management Sciences (LUMS) has introduced a Sanskrit course, marking a significant first since partition.  The curriculum includes Hindu epics like the Mahabharata and Gita.  Academics emphasize Sanskrit's regional unifying role and aim to foster local scholarship on ancient texts, previously dominated by foreign researchers.

title: 'Main Bihar se hoon': Vaibhav Sooryavanshi hits back at UAE sledging
content: Vaibhav Sooryavanshi smashed an incredible 171 off 95 balls, including fourteen sixes, setting a new U-19 world record in India's 433/6 against UAE. The 14-year-old's dominant innings, marked by a witty exchange with the wicketkeeper, propelled India to a commanding position.  His performance also secured a tournament record for most sixes in a single U-19 Asia Cup innings.

title: From Top Gun to Marvel: How Hollywood mastered the art of propaganda
content: Much like the morality of art, it is absolutely futile to discuss whether a piece of art is ‚Äúpropaganda‚Äù ‚Äì but that hasn‚Äôt stopped critics from convulsing in unison over Aditya Dhar‚Äôs magnum opus Dhurandhar. The title track of the movie contains the line: ‚ÄúLadies and gentlemen, you are not ready for this.‚Äù

title: 'Pressure will pile': Gill's form under scrutiny; ex-cricketer asks Samson to 'be ready'
content: Former India cricketer Irfan Pathan believes Shubman Gill is under immense pressure due to his recent T20I struggles, with the T20 World Cup approaching. Pathan emphasized that Gill must score runs to secure his place, especially with Sanju Samson waiting in the wings. Gill's form is crucial for the team's powerplay starts and his leadership role.

title: Delhi‚Äôs school fee law goes live: What changes for parents and schools this academic year
content: Delhi's new education act aims to curb arbitrary private school fee hikes. The law mandates itemized fee heads, caps on certain charges, and prohibits disguised capitation fees. User-based services must be no-profit, no-loss. A School-Level Fee Regulation Committee, including parents, will now approve fee structures, ensuring transparency and predictability for three years.

title: Ayesha Curry‚Äôs mother-daughter night out subtly counters Stephen Curry rumor
content: Ayesha Curry recently shared a heartwarming mother-daughter outing with her daughters Riley and Ryan, attending a concert by their favorite K-pop-inspired group, KATSEYE. Stephen Curry also shared the post on his Instagram story, highlighting the family's enjoyment of the event. The popular six-member group, formed from Netflix's Pop Star Academy, is currently on their 'Beautiful Chaos Tour'.

title: 'Something wrong in HC': SC scraps plea on Karur stampede probe; warns TN govt
content: The Supreme Court rejected Tamil Nadu's plea to modify its order suspending the state's inquiry commission and SIT probe into the Karur stampede. Emphasizing fairness, the bench also criticized a Madras High Court report on a writ petition's registration. The court previously ordered a CBI investigation and a supervisory committee.

title: PM Modi, Gill, fashion show: Messi's India tour has everything but football
content: Lionel Messi is set to visit India for the 'GOAT India Tour 2025', his first trip since 2011, but this time without any competitive matches. The tour focuses on promotional events and appearances across Kolkata, Hyderabad, Mumbai, and New Delhi, including meetings with dignitaries and a charity fashion show.

title: Red Fort blast probe: NIA raids Hazaribag home of 'ISIS operative'; gadgets, documents scanned
content: In the early hours, Hazaribag was the scene of a high-stakes NIA operation at the residence of Shahnawaz Alam, a known ISIS operative currently imprisoned in Pune. This raid, part of an investigation into the recent Red Fort bombing in Delhi, focused on uncovering extremist materials and digital devices.

title: Chest pain vs heart attack: Cardiologist explains how to spot the difference
content: Delhi cardiologist Dr. Shailesh Singh advises distinguishing between heart-related chest pain and minor discomfort. He stresses that pain during exertion, feeling like pressure or squeezing, and easing with rest, is a classic cardiac sign. Sharp, fleeting pains or those aggravated by touch or deep breaths are less likely to be heart issues.

title: Which GenAI courses became India‚Äôs top choice in 2025 amid soaring AI demand?
content: India witnessed a surge in GenAI learning in 2025, with Coursera reporting over 3.6 million enrolments, the highest globally. Learners explored courses ranging from introductory AI to specialised GenAI skills, including prompt engineering, LLM applications, and AI workflow automation. Top-ranked programmes came from Google Cloud, IBM, AWS, Vanderbilt University, and DeepLearning.AI. Key skills focused on automation workflows, data literacy, cybersecurity, and problem solving. The trend reflects India‚Äôs growing preparation for AI-driven careers and an AI-ready workforce.

title: From ages 8 to 18: How an all-girl team is taking free chess to rural India
content: The evolution of the chess queen finds a parallel in rural India, where the ‚ÄúCheckmate Betul‚Äù initiative, launched by US-based Avika Shukla, offers free, structured chess training to girls with no prior access. The programme, run by an all-girl global team, is helping students gain confidence, focus and new skills while overcoming significant logistical hurdles.

title: New power bloc: Trump may be ditching G7 for new 'Core-5'; which countries are on list
content: Reports suggest Donald Trump is considering a new "Core-5" bloc including China and Russia, a stark contrast to his previous stance. This idea, though unconfirmed, aligns with his transactional approach to foreign policy. The proposal emerges amidst ongoing trade tensions and follows a recent call between PM Modi and Trump.

title: 'Cricketers indulge in vices during overseas tours': Ravindra Jadeja's wife claims
content: Ravindra Jadeja's wife, Rivaba, has sparked discussion by alleging that some Indian cricketers engage in vices during overseas tours, while asserting her husband remains untouched by such activities. She highlighted that players often act freely away from public scrutiny, but Jadeja, understanding his responsibilities, avoids these temptations. Her remarks have gained traction online.

title: The most impactful women's recruit on every 2026 top-25 class roster
content: a look at the most impactful signee in each of the nation's top recruiting classes . the top scouts have a clearer picture of what next season will look like for many of them . last year, no one has done star power like USC coach Lindsay Gottlieb .

title: Grading the Penguins, Oilers on the Jarry-Skinner goaltending swap
content: the Pittsburgh Penguins sent goaltender Tristan Jarry and forward Sam Poulin to the Edmonton Oilers in exchange for goalie Stuart Skinner , defenseman Brett Kulak and a 2029 second-round pick .

title: We made score picks for every postseason college football game
content: the 12-team college football playoff is no longer new . there are more justifiably aggrieved teams at being left out . the annual coaching carousel always impacts the postseason . new coach Pete Golding will make his debut in the biggest game in team history .

title: The NFL's best player through 14 games is ...? Barnwell stacks MVP candidates, picks winner
content: quarterbacks Drake Maye and Matthew Stafford have a clear top two for MVP in the betting market . there's still enough time left in the season for that to shift if another candidate gets hot and leads his team to a division title or a top seed in the conference down the stretch .

title: Five players who offer upside for your lineup in Week 15
content: fantasy managers should consider starting Jauan Jennings in Week 15 . the playoffs already rolling in ESPN standard leagues and plenty of formats kicking off their tournaments this week . think big-play chops here and favorable deployment based on the week 15 slate of games .

title: Power Rankings: The 4-team race for No. 1
content: four teams had a legitimate case to be no. 1 in this week's Power Rankings . Michigan took the top spot thanks to the Wolverines' dominance at the Players Era Festival in Las Vegas . Arizona was our No. 1 team heading into Feast Week after the Wildcats knocked off UConn .

title: Encore, Aspinall! Encore, Topuria! Five UFC rematches to look for in 2026
content: two of the first three numbered events in 2026 will feature rematches in the main event . if Brandon Royval wins, it could lead to a no contest in the heavyweight title fight . the men's bantamweight championship is set for 2026 . click here for all the latest news .

title: MLB winter meetings winners, losers and head-scratching moves
content: the 2025 winter meetings didn't have a $700 million-plus deal like last year . but there were still a number of impactful free agent signings . veteran slugger Kyle Schwarber chose to return to the Philadelphia Phillies on a five-year deal in the first major splash of the meetings .

title: As responsibilities evolve, MLB manager salaries still lag behind top coaches in other sports
content: Pat Murphy and Stephen Vogt both won manager of the year for the first time in 2024 . the two became just the second managers in each league to win the award in back-to-back seasons . this year, they became the first managers in a row to receive the award .

title: Men's class rankings: USC into top 10; Tennessee and Texas A&M join
content: the biggest winner of this most recent update was USC . both of their signees made enormous leaps in the player rankings . the Trojans jumped from no. 24 all the way to no. 9 despite not adding any commitments .

title: Mohan Yadav says ‚Äòelimination‚Äô of Maoism his biggest feat; Congress rakes up farmer issues, debt
content: The Chief Minister said that the State has received investment proposals of more than ‚Çπ32 lakh crore in the past two years and those of ‚Çπ8.57 lakh crore have been materialised so far

title: Goa nightclub fire: The party that took a tragic turn
content: On December 6, a fire claimed 25 lives during a party at Birch by Romeo Lane, an establishment in Arpora in Goa. The restaurant-cum-club was built on a salt pan and had only a narrow entrance and exit, survivors and activists allege. Rishikesh Bahadur Desai reports on the night‚Äôs happenings and the worries of Goans about unregulated real-estate development, marked by illegal construction, lax fire safety, and poor crowd control

title: Need to take development to Maoist-affected areas, says CM Sai
content: In the past two years, 505 Naxalites have been neutralised, 2,386 have surrendered, and 1,901 have been arrested, says Chhattisgarh Chief Minister Vishnu Deo Sai

title: Very optimistic: India on possibility of sealing trade deal with Oman during PM Modi's visit
content: We have here immense faith that this agreement, if signed during this visit, will significantly deepen the economic ties between India and Oman, says Arun Chatterjee, a Secretary in the Ministry of External Affairs (MEA)

title: Congress to boycott first day of Chhattisgarh Assembly session: LoP Mahant
content: I have made a decision. I am telling my colleagues in front of you that we are completely boycotting the Assembly session on December 14, says Senior Congress leader Charandas Mahant

title: Madras High Court clears decks for evicting St. Peter‚Äôs Matriculation School in St. Thomas Mount
content: Justices S.M. Subramaniam and C. Kumarappan dismiss a writ petition filed by the school against the government‚Äôs refusal to part with the public property

title: A.P. govt. mandates two e-waste collection drives every month
content: ULBs must hold e-waste collection drives on 10th and 20th of every month, supported by designated collection points, strict record-keeping and a dedicated Nodal Officer, says SOP

title: Trial court concludes that prosecution failed to prove charges against actor Dileep in 2017 actor rape case
content: The prosecution‚Äôs case was that the actor conspired with the accused to take revenge against the woman actor for defaming him and wrecking his marital life.

title: India, China hold fresh talks in Beijing; both sides say ‚Äòpositive progress‚Äô in ties after Modi‚ÄìXi meet
content: The Indian side emphasised on the need for early resolution of outstanding issues pertaining to export control, MEA said in a statement.

title: Terrorist associated with Jaish-e-Mohammad held from J&K‚Äôs Pulwama; grenade recovered
content: Acting on credible input about the movement of one suspect at Naner Midoora, one terrorist associate, identified as Musaib Nazir, Son of Nazir Ahmad Teli, resident of Ladhoo Khrew, associated with Jaish e Muhammad, was apprehended, says the police.

title: Supreme Court stays Kerala HC declaration on Munambam land
content: Court clarifies it has not stayed the direction of the High Court upholding the government order appointing an inquiry commission to ascertain ownership of the disputed area

title: Prominent leaders from Assam join the Congress
content: Assam Congress president Gaurav Gogoi said that Assam had been facing serious problems of unemployment during the last ten years of the BJP rule as industries had shut down

title: Are Urvashi‚Äôs days too numbered?
content: The iconic single screen in south Bengaluru, which has had over a 50-year run, is in the midst of land litigation

title: Sparkling conversations at the Hyderabad edition of Lit For Life Dialogue
content: Non-fiction authors Manu Pillai, Neha Dixit, and Arundhati Ghosh discuss on feminist perspectives of Mughal history, women workers slipping through economic cracks, and the definition of polyamory

title: NHL Power Rankings: New 1-32 poll, plus fantasy hockey panic or patience
content: a panel of ESPN fantasy hockey commentators, analysts, reporters and editors send in a 1-32 poll based on the games through Wednesday . it's not too late to join ESPN Fantasy Hockey , with new leagues starting every Monday .

title: No Cabinet mantri present, Rajya Sabha adjourned for 10 minutes
content: opposition MPs say none of the Cabinet ministers are in the House . a cabinet minister in the Ho-use should come, he says . the parliamentary affairs minister says he had to be in LS to mourn the death of former Speaker .

title: Intruder held along border in Jammu: BSF officials
content: The individual identified as Abdul Khalik, has been handed over to Police Post Pargwal for further¬†legal¬†action

title: RSS chief Bhagwat, Home Minister Amit Shah unveil statue of V.D. Savarkar in Andaman & Nicobar Islands
content: The event took place to mark 116 years of Savarkar‚Äôs poem titled Sagara Pran Talmalala, which translates as ‚ÄòMy soul is in torment‚Äô

title: All three political fronts expect improved showing in Thiruvananthapuram Corporation
content: While LDF appears confident of winning more than the 51 wards that the front won last time, UDF is vying to increase its tally from just 10 out of the 100 wards. For BJP, realising the decade-long push for power in the Corporation tops its agenda

title: PF contributions on wages beyond ‚Çπ15,000 voluntary: Labour Ministry
content: The Code on Social Security replaces the Employees‚Äô Provident Funds and Miscellaneous Provisions Act, 1952

title: Tracing rise and fall of football in Hyderabad; will Messi‚Äôs tour reignite the spark?
content: Hyderabad produced a host of players who have represented the country at various international events, including two Olympic Games

title: Anurag Thakur seeks action over e-cigarette use
content: The MP says the use of banned device inside House violates law, decorum and sends wrong message to youth

title: Karnataka updates procedures for medical registration and certification linked to mandatory rural service
content: Candidates completing MBBS, postgraduate, or super-specialty degrees in Karnataka are not eligible for permanent registration until they complete the mandatory service

title: Issue stamp commemorating centenary of Mahatma Gandhi and Sree Narayana Guru‚Äôs meeting: K.C. Venugopal
content: During Zero Hour in the Lok Sabha, K.C. Venugopal called on the government to release a commemorative coin and postage stamp to mark the centenary of the 1925 meeting

title: Thirupparankundram row: No evidence to establish stone pillar is a deepathoon, says T.N. govt.
content: Advocate General P.S. Raman, representing the State, referred to the previous judgments in connection to the issue. He pointed out there was no mention of the deepathoon in the orders on the suit filed in 1920 demarcating the portions belonging to the temple and the dargah

title: Government likely to rename MGNREGS to ‚ÄòPujya Bapu Gramin Rozgar Yojana‚Äô
content: There was no official announcement on the amended legislation; the Bill is likely to increase the guaranteed employment up to 100 days to 125 days, and introduce tweaks for better utilisation of funds, especially in economically weaker States

title: Kozhikode Corporation Council bids farewell as term nears end
content: The current council will stay in office until the new one takes charge, possibly before December 20; Mayor Beena Philip highlighted the council‚Äôs achievements over five years, while opposition councillors voiced regret over projects that had stalled

title: India expresses concern after Thailand-Cambodia fighting¬†damaged Preah Vihear complex
content: Preah Vihear temple complex, a UNESCO World Heritage Site, comprises temples dedicated to Lord Shiva dating back to the 11th century; Archaeological Survey of India has been part of conservation and restoration work on the ancient Khmer temples in Cambodia since 1986

title: Cover doctors deputed for COVID-19 duty under PMGKY: Supreme Court
content: Supreme Court judgment affirms requisition of doctors and health workers during COVID-19 for PMGKY insurance claims

title: Court calls for fair reporting of court proceedings
content: When the court convened on Friday to decide on the quantum of punishment for the convicts in the 2017 actor rape case, an exasperated Honey M. Varghese, the Principal Sessions Judge, suggested fair reporting of court proceedings and balanced comments without slandering the judicial system

title: CPI(M) unleashing violence out of fear of defeat, says KPCC president Sunny Joseph
content: CPI(M) workers targeted United Democratic Front (UDF) candidates and booth agents on the polling day and afterwards, with even women candidates getting brutally assaulted, alleges KPCC president

title: Watch: Novo Nordisk brings Ozempic to India for type 2 diabetes treatment
content: Danish pharma major Novo Nordisk on December 12, launched its blockbuster type 2 diabetes treatment injection Ozempic, globally popular for its weight-loss benefits. Ozempic is now available in India as 0.25 mg, 0.5 mg and 1 mg in ‚ÄòFlexTouch Pen‚Äô - an easy-to-use, once-weekly pen device.

title: CBI arrests six involved in transnational cybercrime
content: The accused persons had manipulated people in the U.S. into transferring $8.5 million to cryptocurrency wallets and foreign bank accounts

title: High vector indices signal dengue alarm in Thiruvananthapuram district
content: Rise in mosquito density is a clear indication that dengue cases can spike any time, say senior Health officials

title: Rajya Sabha resolution seeks free, compulsory early childhood care
content: Sudha Murty urges constitutional amendment for early childhood care and education through strengthened Anganwadi services

title: Supreme Court seeks response on plea to make cancer notifiable disease
content: In his plea, a retired AIIMS oncologist has highlighted that 90% of India‚Äôs population was currently not covered in any systematic cancer surveillance mechanism. The petition also flags ‚Äòchronic and severe under-reporting‚Äô of cases and promotion of misinformation such as ‚Äòcow urine as cancer cure‚Äô.

title: Karnataka: About 31% of SCSP/TSP funds used for guarantee schemes since 2023
content: Social Welfare Minister defended it stating that Section 7(C) of the SCSP/TSP Act allows utilisation of the funds in tune with the population of SCs and STs

title: ‚ÄòOmission‚Äô of Kuki-Zo areas in President‚Äôs Manipur visit draws flak
content: Droupadi Murmu concluded her two-day visit after inaugurating a slew of developmental projects in the Naga-dominated Senapati district

title: GCDA exploring possibility of publicising quantum of stadium renovation works and its cost
content: The GCDA had identified 13 renovation works to be either completed or are at various stages of progress by the sponsor while taking possession of the stadium

title: Ernakulam all set to count votes as 7,374 candidates await people‚Äôs mandate
content: The district recorded 74.57% of voter turnout as 19,89,428 of the total 26,67,746 electors exercised their franchise

title: Aland voter fraud: Former BJP MLA, son named prime accused
content: Karnataka SIT likely to seek court direction for ECI to share technical data; the accused allegedly forged forms to delete almost 6,000 names from electoral roll in 2023

title: Never write on anything sub judice, CJI Kant's advice
content: Solicitor-General flags ‚Äòconcurrent, narrative building' of sub judice cases outside courtrooms; Sibal counters, saying they are called 'commentary' and does not amount to any sacrilege

title: 35 rescued after fire at hotel in Ahmedabad commercial complex; no casualties
content: Preliminary information suggests the fire originated in the hotel's pantry, where a refrigerator, gas stove and a cylinder were kept

title: Participation surge for Young Innovators Programme 8.0
content: Student registrations for college and higher education categories see threefold increase compared to previous cohorts

title: At IFFK opening, ripples of actor assault case
content: 30th edition of film festival gets under way with Kerala Culture Minister expressing solidarity with the survivor in the actor assault case. Referring to the opening film Palestine 36, he says the State stands with the oppressed people of Palestine.

title: Railways to deploy 5,000 ex-servicemen as pointsmen amid staff shortage
content: Ex-servicemen to be recruited on a short-term contractual basis; move comes amid stiff resistance from trade unions, and a CRS recommendation against contractual staff¬†in safety-critical roles

title: Government can intervene to cap fares, but this can‚Äôt be done throughout the year, says Aviation Minister
content: It‚Äôs important to understand market demand and supply, said Civil Aviation Minister K Rammohan Naidu.

title: IndiGo crisis: Govt clarifies on capping air fares; what aviation minister said in LS
content: The TOI News Desk comprises a dedicated and tireless team of journalists who operate around the clock to deliver the most current and comprehensive news and updates to the readers of The Times of India worldwide. With an unwavering commitment to excellence in journalism, our team is at the forefront of gathering, verifying, and presenting breaking news, in-depth analysis, and insightful reports on a wide range of topics. The TOI News Desk is your trusted source for staying informed and connected to the ever-evolving global landscape, ensuring that our readers are equipped with the latest developments that matter most." title: Black Sea attack: Russian missile hits Turkish vessel; Erdogan presses Putin
content: At TOI World Desk, our dedicated team of seasoned journalists and passionate writers tirelessly sifts through the vast tapestry of global events to bring you the latest news and diverse perspectives round the clock. With an unwavering commitment to accuracy, depth, and timeliness, we strive to keep you informed about the ever-evolving world, delivering a nuanced understanding of international affairs to our readers. Join us on a journey across continents as we unravel the stories that shape our interconnected world. Read More

title: Election 2.0: There's a new political guru in town, and it doesn't eat, sleep or blink
content: despite months of padyatras, booth-level outreach and the full weight of Jan Suraaj, the upset was more than a personal setback . it signalled a shift already unfolding beneath the surface: the old era of political strategy is being eclipsed by a new actor that never tires, never forgets and never stops optimising . by 2025, influence is no longer crafted by professionals in war rooms; it is engineer .
